content.description: Climb the overhanging crack to the juggy rail then over the top of the overhang.
content.location: above and to the right of black angus in a deep pit.

content.description: Start on jug and traverse right across boulder on good crimp rail with a few small feet

This climb is prominent, inspiring, and a little bit dicey, with great moves!Â To start it, step off the big platform onto the start holds (low left hand slopey sidepull, right hand incut but small crimp) above a very dangerous gap in the platform. Climb up through a small horn and a gaston to a jug near the tree, then a fairly moderate topout.Important: have an attentive spotter ready to push you *away* from the boulder onto the pads, to avoid the pit (maybe throw a pad down in the pit anyway in case you slide down). I felt fairly safe on it because you are pushing away from the pit to move upward, but the feet are very bad so a slip is possible.
content.location: To the left of the Black Angus Boulder and to the right of the Bubblegum boulder. A large upward slanting rock platform leads to a prominent slightly overhanging face to the right of the tree. The platform drops off to a dangerous pit (about 2 feet wide) right before the boulder, spot this well!

content.description: Start on a jug on the right of the boulder and traverse left on the lip using small edges, turn the corner of the boulder and top out.
content.location: Right off the main trail, boulder on the left in the hanger 18 area.

content.description: Sit down start on a good sidepull and sloping hold.  Move up to a small crimp in the middle of the face and to a weird pocket/shallow sidepull.  Make a big move up to a good edge, and then to a pinch and top out.
content.location: Just off the trail, on the left side of the boulder.

content.description: Between Gumball (L) and Black Angus (R). Use left arete and the seam of Black Angus. WIDE arms.
content.location: Between Gumball (L) and Black Angus (R) in Hanger 18

content.description: SDS with a large sidepull. Climb up past a gaston, a pinch, a two finger slot, and finally the thin seam on the slab.
content.protection:
1-2 pads.  

  The landing is easy to pad despite one awkward protruding boulder. Because of this boulder, 2 pads are recommended.

content.description: Climbs the prow. Start down in the pit, slightly around the corner on a horizontal crack. Trend leftwards out around the prow then straight up.
content.location: This often overlooked climb in Hanger 18 is a rather fun problem worth checking out. Walk up to In the Face of Danger and turn left. The pit is where you're headed. If you're adventurous, the pit is also home to the start of The Oubliette
